noun.description: A sequence of actions regularly followed; a fixed program.
examples: I settled down into a routine of work and sleep
as a matter of routine a report will be sent to the director

adjective.description: Performed as part of a regular procedure rather than for a special reason.
examples: the principal insisted that this was just a routine annual drill
all had been routined with smoothness

origin: Late 17th century (denoting a regular course or procedure): from French, from route road (see route).
